intro: Gordonia brenesii, commonly known as the Costa Rican gordonia, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its flowers are usually pink or white and bloom in the spring. Gordonia brenesii is valued for its ornamental appeal and plays a role in local ecosystems.
